page.title: 15FARMING
page.content:
The area is mainly one of Arable farming. A great deal of{Winter {Barley}is grown which is sold at local markets for malting or for animal food. Grain is harvested and put into driers and then stored in siloes until it is sold.
More land is being used for growing cash crops. {Sugar Beet}is common as there are nearby sugar refineries at Kings Lynn and Whissington. {Peas}are grown and vined under contract to freezing companies in Kings Lynn and Fakenham. Some{Fodder Beet}is also grown for animal food.
Poultry farming is also carried out on a large and a small scale. Battery hens are kept in large sheds where they produce eggs which are sild locally.
